38348492.review:
确实是一代神作。
整体的剧情设置非常好，回收了很多伏笔。托前两章的福，人物塑造也非常丰满。
在这个篇章里终于见到了BETA，也见识到了这个世界的残酷。[spoiler]  队友一个个离去，带来的痛苦的同时，女武神小队的精神仍然在延续，死力尽职，生即尽善，绝不白死。  [/spoiler]
整个故事有燃点有泣点，主角也不是一成不变，而是不断地在和别人的交流中成长。同时这是一个动态的故事，不仅是主角在动，能感觉到世界也在动。在故事描述不到的世界各地，同时发生着变化。
音乐方面数首BGM都不错，有一两首钢琴曲非常应景，有op燃到爆。
最后可惜的是只有一个结局，不过也许就是因为只有一个结局，所以才成为了神作。
汉化质量也是比较高的，尽可能地做到了传神。

从作品整体素质以及中文化角度来说，这应该是国人在steam上能玩到的最好最完善的gal之一（另一个就是石头门了），所有喜欢在steam上玩GAL的玩家们都不应该错过这部作品。

38341305.review:
Muv Luv : Alternative has it all : giant robots, mindblowing twists, tearjerkings moments, an amazing soundtrack, and better production value than Muv Luv could make one expect. It is not the best rated title on VNDB for nothing, and its middle part is a lesson of storytelling.

Its other main achievement is to complete Muv Luv, and to bring it to a quality level that's in definitive not too far off from this entry. Reading MLA brings an enormous lot to one's enjoyement of the first game. But its reliance on the latter also plagues the first part of the game (perpetual reference to both Extra and Unlimited, repetition of events with many not-so-impressive twists). To get all the details, I would recommend to go through Muv Luv once more just before jumping into Alternative.

The cast of MLA is...okay. Most of the characters are enjoyable (and benefit greatly from having been elaborated throughout the first entry of the series), even if they pale when compared to the cast of more character-driven VN's (Dies Irae, Steins:Gate, ...). Shirogane might be, in fact, the most irritating, especially towards the end of the game, which is a problem considering you get to spend so many hours inside of his head.

The plot is great, with a couple of issues. The beginning tends to drag, the middle is a masterpiece, and the ending is a slap in the face. However, "the middle" stands for the 30-40 hours between the introduction and the final chapter, which hit me hard like no other fiction work before, and singlehandedly earned MLA its worldwide fame. And hey, even if the start is slow, it is always more enjoyable than Extra. About the ending...well, some people love it, but I almost felt insulted by the path chosen by the writers. Nothing grave enough to prevent me from considering the whole story as one of the most enthralling epic provided by the VN medium.

Production value-wise, we are suprisingly well-off. While many assets are directly taken from the first entry in the series, the CG's are gorgeous, the voiceover is as great as you might expect, and the soundtrack...well the soundtrack is my favorite part of this masterpiece of a game.

When I finished MLA, I was certain that game would be another 10/10 in my book, having provided me one of the most intense reading experiences of my VN reader life. However, as I am writing this review, I am forced to take a step back, especially when comparing it to other games I recently finished. If I wasn't the mecha/military drama junkie I am, would I have enjoyed this game as much as I did ? Would reading Extra and Unlimited be a worthwile time investment for what MLA ultimately has to offer ? Would I be able to withstand the crappy ending ? The cringy dating sim-y romance ? I still don't have the answer to these questions. Howerver, I know that I had a blast reading Muv Luv Alternative, a highly demanding, somewhat flawed, but generous game with a surprsingly broad appeal.

9/10

38258889.review:
续接本篇两部。
Alternative篇全篇给人一种“天将降大任于是人也（略）”的感觉，男主光环爆表的同时又在不断喂屎，吃屎吃到麻木，但是一切却又显得顺理成章，因为没有经历过绝望，人就不能成长。男主本想凭着自己的天赋和在世界线之间的经历大显身手，却发现还有很多事是他想不到的，失败感油然而生，他想逃避，他的确逃了，但是又发现逃避是没用的，只有彻底正视眼前的绝望克服它，才能让原本和平的生活不受波及。所以在这之后男主成长了，不单单是他暂时回到Extra篇世界中老师见到他时所说得那种气质上的截然不同，更多的是面对他人对自己的信任和对自己能力的认识上有了责任感，不会白白浪费这一切。Alternative篇后半部分给人一种直击心灵的感觉，很多电影小说都会强调的一些东西在这部分有很强的共鸣感，配合动画一般直观而连贯的立绘演出看得非常痛快。
随着感官理解上的剧情高潮的结束，故事的中心才摆在我们面前，如同结尾副标题，我们看着Extra篇的各个角色和受到世界线波及也好还是既定登场也罢的角色在开男主玩笑，回想起故事的点点滴滴，想到那些无论在什么地方，都在想着你的人；无论在怎样的环境成长，还是会选择你的人；无论面临什么样的困难，依然陪在你身边的人，我们明白了所有都是为了表达“真爱”。

38238353.review:
强烈推荐！！！
Extra篇给我体验最好的是纯夏和冥夜线的剧情，身为一个伪galgame爱好者，已经很久没有可以不失兴趣的想要一口气体验完一条线的内容。进入Unlimited篇，共通线（应该可以这么说吧）剧情相当不错，穿越到一个比较残酷的世界，虽然这样，还是比较偏日常的展开，已经随着白银武对这个新世界的“探索”和一定程度进行不同世界观的碰撞产生了某些变化，和这个世界的人一起经过层层考验，成为一个团队。然而这些漂亮的展开，却没有一个升华，迎来的却是几条分线突然“萎缩”的结尾，感觉很不好。
Muv-Luv无印是一个感觉不错但很平凡的作品，但是Muv-Luv Alternative开始之后我彻底被折服了。
开篇就以一个“未来人”的身份开始开始游戏，白银武由于有了经历过的“经验”，还由于经历过很多考验，有了所谓坚定的信念，然而很快就意识到之前的世界得到的只不过是“过家家”的经验罢了。啊，再继续说就剧透了，随着剧情的进行，Alternative篇展现了一个全新的“世界”，比Unlimited篇对世界的认识更加深刻，人物的成长更加明显，而且剧情更加的热血呢。
全程看完下来，Muv-Luv Alternative才是游戏真正的开始，Muv-Luv无印就是一个序章，虽然如此，却很不可或缺，Muv-Luv无印的体验会使的Alternative篇的体检更加深刻，所以按次序看完每个篇章的内容（包括所以个人线路），才是这部游戏的完全体。
感谢把这部经典作品重新发布到steam和实现汉化共享的人们，希望能把其他更多经典的galgame出现在steam并提供官方中文。
最后，[spoiler]我永远喜欢鉴纯夏（滑稽）。 ——鲁迅[/spoiler]

37970037.review:
Pros:
+ An ambitious story that spans parallel universe
+ A lot of foreshadowing/plot twists
+ Realistic MC considering what he has gone through
+ A lot of technical details in exposition
+ Numerous event CGs and 3D animation stand up to the test of time and feel dynamic

Cons:
- Suffers from a mediocre prequel whose plot is required for this installment
- A very slow start (the first 4 episodes)
- A relatively weak ending
- Some info-dumping

If you were discouraged by how mediocre its prequel is, I would still recommend reading MLA (make sure to read a synopsis of Muv Luv). While there are definitely weaknesses in this installment, its unique ability to weave together a compelling narrative with a grand scope definitely make the experience worthwhile. If you are looking for a science fiction story with serious plot, don't miss this one.
8/10

Similar VN recommendation (sci-fi mecha): baldr sky dive 1+2 (though no English translation available as of yet)

37828734.review:
This is a game that is a sequel to Muv-Luv, and playing the previous game helps understand the context of this one, [spoiler]especially considering the timeline hopping and flashbacks to the first Muv-Luv[/spoiler]. Even if game 1 doesn't seem like your cup of tea, it is completely worth it just for getting the whole picture of Alternative and its second act. And trust me, it's better to go into this franchise with zero context.
I'm still in the middle of playing this game, and having been hyped for over a year have not been dissapointed. Do you like stories of war, science fiction, and philosophical dilemnas over your own humanity and intrinsic worth in the face of the universe? Even if you don't, play this game. It is full of quandries, both fantastical and solidified in our current reality; perhaps even some we or our succesors will have to answer for themselves in the face of ever accelerating technological advances.
This triology may have started off as a simplistic story about developing a romantic relationship with 5 [spoiler](or 6?)[/spoiler] lovely girls, but has evolved into so much more that it is one of those games that transcends gender and cultural divides. It is a game every person should play before they die; if not for the life lessons, then for the journey.

37513142.review:
偶尔听到op未来咆哮，这一小契机让我产生玩muv系列的念头，在此之前对于其的口碑也有一定的了解，被称为‘燃泣郁’三个方面均达到了顶峰的作品，批评空间上的极为前列作品之一，这几点让我对muv这个系列的作品产生了兴趣。
就extra篇来说，开篇无厘头，欢快的音乐，气氛轻松缓和，很普通的校园恋爱戏剧。
unlimited篇整个故事完全走向另外一个方向，外星生物入侵地球，人类使用战术机和外星生物（简称beta）进行战争，男主角白银武穿越世界线来到了一个和之前完全不同的世界，和extra篇的欢快气氛倒是形成了对比。不过整个ul篇一直就是训练，练习，到最后莫名结束的时候只出现过一次beta的剪影而已。分支剧情就不想吐槽了，同一张图片换了个人，其余似乎也没什么太大变化！快进收成就都觉得是浪费时间！
当时steam并没有alternative，因此各种找资源再安装为了玩这一部分搞的简直是焦头烂额，原来galgame可以这么难安装。
steam版本不仅免除了这个问题，而且最重要的是有官中！！！
画质效果比起盗版也经过了增强，而且还删掉了一个不得了的场景，光这一点我得说good job !
不过比起steam版本标题画面的纯夏，我更喜欢原版的标题画面。
对于alternative篇，称为视觉小说界上的巅峰并不夸张，和前两个章篇完全不在一个级别之上，准确的说前面两个章篇完全是在给al篇铺垫，如果没有al篇，那么extra和unlimited篇也不过是极其平庸的作品罢了。
从标题音乐，整个游戏的气氛就已经转变到了能让人紧张激动的感觉，而op未来咆哮作为让我入坑的因素也是al篇的开场op。
‘站起来，承受天命的战士们！’
整个al篇贯穿了这么一句话，这也是让我最让我燃起来的一句话！

对于女性角色的设定，对于我个人而言，青梅竹马是我比较倾向的一类女性，虽说现在大多说后宫漫画动画里，青梅竹马都斗不过后来居上的女主角，所谓的苦逼女二号（哭晕）。
ul篇里纯夏完全消失，而在ul篇的最后让我产生了社霞就是纯夏的错觉，但到了al篇便发觉并不是这样.....
[spoiler]以00元件身份复活，同时也是让武成为因果导体的原因 	[/spoiler]

al篇开头一部分和ul篇一样节奏不紧不慢，但到某一个部分之后整个剧情直接爆炸式发展，和beta的战斗也是真正意义上的打响！
结合ul篇和al篇让其剧情世界观的铺垫相当的完整，beta的种类特点，行动特性，独特的战斗设定（比如光线级别beta和空军的互相牵制）等等....
战斗系统的设计在视觉小说里也很别具一格（这就是难以安装的原因吗？？），虽然和动画里还差了点什么，但是演出效果足以在视觉小说里位列巅峰。
甲21战个人感觉是整个游戏最精彩的一战，凄乃煌二型直接弹开数只光线级beta攻击，并进行绝地反击的那一幕简直燃的不行！
各国内战里，牵扯到的极右政治思想本人并不发表意见，不是很了解这一方面的东西。
最后的樱花作战，有点后劲不足，进攻母巢本应该是最为让人期待的一战，但是却远不及甲21给我的那种真正大战的感觉，倒是有种小分队去偷家的赶脚。
虽然角色的演出精彩，与其说燃，更多的是悲壮，死亡flag一个接着一个插。
结局喜发糖.........................
作为已经有十几年历史的游戏，能有这般的剧本已经相当不错了，人物虽然很多但是处理的却有条不乱，刻画的也相当出色，光这一点就已经是大多数galgame无法比拟的。
不过很多槽点，比如女化尊人是什么鬼？mikoto?
卫士服起初的爆衣装让我有点哭笑不得，人物的造型可以说要多奇葩有多奇葩，画风怪异程度个人感觉和key的kanon有的一比，搞不好人物头发可以把人扎死也说不定！？al篇后期出场女性角色正常了许多。
不过即使小瑕疵多，但是瑕不掩瑜，如果十分满，九分级别的强作！
期待有生之年本篇动画。

37263026.review:
First, I say play Muv-Luv Extra+Unlimited first. This is a sequel after all that.

Second, I say ... damn. The lore is cool as hell. Overall the story is pretty good, then unfortunately drops towards the end, but I'd say its worth the journey. Especially for that lore, man, I would love it if they had a sequel to Alternative and continue on whats happening with Humanity. I know there's stuff like that for Unlimited, but dang, I want to see what happened immediately after here. The conflict with the BETA is one of the coolest things around. 

There are no branching routes, there is just one straight story to follow. Thus the choices don't have big effects. At most, they'll change a few scenes slightly by making Shirogane (thats the main character) speak with the character you seem to favor in choices. That sort of thing. The story overall will stay the same. I don't think that's much of a bad thing, Muv-Luv EXTRA has ya covered for choices, Unlimited has it to a lesser extent. Alternative don't need it, it does a well enough job without choices that change things around.

Though I don't quite get why this has been praised as the best VN ever, its most certainly up there. I'd give it the best VN lore, though, cause dang am I interested. Pick up Muv-Luv and Muv-Luv Alternative if you like VNs, you'll most likely enjoy this.

36812375.review:
I'd like to start this review by saying that Muv-Luv Alternative had blown my expectations out of the roof with regards to how good a Visual Novel can be. I came in expecting it to be good but did not expect it to be [i]this[/i] good.

Believe the hype. This is the real deal.

If you're into mecha/military sci-fi and don't mind a bit of anime fluff, Muv-Luv Alternative offers one of the most compelling storylines I've ever had the pleasure of experiencing. 

The world setting is bleak and is presented in a somewhat realistic (anime) manner that's both believable and interesting.

Though categorically, I'd rate the sci-fi elements to be a bit light but the writer for this scenario did an amazing job in tying in a lot of elements together while remaining logical and coherent to the main over-arching plot. Everything presented in the story has its place in the world and never at anytime did I feel that it was just tacked on just to fulfill a demographic need.

The cast of characters in this world are of course based on typical anime tropes but do have their individual reasons for behaving the way they are. Though their characterizations are not deep but their beliefs and motivations are belivable (as with how anime characters are). There were some stand out characters (Meiya, Yuuko, Marimo, Isumi) but overall, they all complement each other very well.

As with any good book, the story does take a bit time to to ramp up but when it does it does not let up. The story presented here is complete and ends with a great feeling that we too, as the reader, has experienced all the bitterness, hardships and the fleeting moments of happiness that main protagonist has felt, throughout his journey through this nightmarish world he finds himself in.

There is a great sense of flow, in which each section builds upon the previous parts of the narrative, propelling the story further with great urgency. 

I was especially impressed with the way battles were presented, which felt very dynamic and exciting, especially when most of the action is presented using moving drawn stills and camera effects (zooms, pans, filters, etc.).

The few negatives I have about this title is how much I didn't want the story to end. Also there were some pacing issues near the end but it did not detract from the overall epic ending that it successfully conveyed. There were also instances where certain scenes dragged out for far too long but I guess it could have been a necessity, due to some of the complex ideas they were trying to present to the reader.

Overall, I highly recommend this title.

For the full experience, please start with Muv-Luv Extra followed by Muv-Luv Unlimited. As much as Muv-Luv Extra was a chore to read but once you complete Muv-Luv Alternative, you'll realize the genius that Muv-Luv Extra truly is.

All I know is, I am looking forward to any translated Muv-Luv titles in the future.

If you're into the visual novel dating sim deal then you should probably play this. I'm told it's one of the best ones and it does a lot of... interesting stuff with that whole concept. If you're like me and indifferent to that but thinking about getting these two games for the mecha aspect, that's where it becomes really difficult to recommend. Not necessarily a knock on the game itself, I just came into it with the wrong expectations. This is very much an eroge visual novel about a ton of girls orbitting one oblivious dude's crotch, even if it does eventually involve giant robots and aliens and other sci-fi stuff. And if the former is your thing, again, this is almost certainly for you. But if you're just curious about the one super hyped up mecha visual novel you'll probably want to save yourself the time and money. While the mecha aspect definitely sees a huge jump in quality once you get to Alternative, you're talking about over 20 hours minimum to get there (I used a walkthrough), and even then it takes it's sweet time getting to (no spoilers) the parts you've actually wanted to see since halfway through the previous game, and would only stand up to average/slightly above average mecha anime or manga.

36430472.review:
I think this is greatest epic ever told in Visual novels, and one of the best stories ever written about alien invasions. 

The premise of the story is actually rather simple, a high-schooler living a happy life in the peaceful modern world, suddenly gets teleported to a world ravaged by aliens, with humanity on its last legs. 

What makes the story astounding, is you actually  live out every part of the experience across the two games, from the cheesy rom-com in the peaceful world, to the initial amazement and tourist-like detachment of getting teleported, to the terror of realising that you probably will die in this alien world, of the cruel fate that stripped away your peaceful life for a certani death. 

Many stories make conflict and wars feel exicting and enjoyable, but this story makes you yearn for the peaceful days that you were once bored of. The titanic human-BETA struggle depicted in this story will awe you with its scale, and the steeled resolve and determination it demands from its soldiers.

You will laugh, grow, rage, despair and cry along with the protagonist's journey, the immersion you feel will make the 40 hour read pass like a breeze.

On the other front, MLA has an extremely high production value, from the moving and dynamic sprites allowing simulation of action scenes, to the HUD interfaces that make you feel like being in a mech, to the orchestral music that pumps with tension and grandeur.

The military side of the story also bustles with tremendous realism. The battles in Muv-Luv are not about the hero wiping out the enemies which is so typical in other stories, the battles in Muv Luv alternative are massive military campaigns, with intricate planning and co-operation across many military branches, with the dynamism and unpredictability you would expect from an actual warfare.

If you like any of those things, buy the two games and read them, it will be an unforgettable experience. However, do note that you HAVE to read the first Muv-Luv game, it lays the emotional foundations of Muv-Luv Alternative, skipping it will ruin the pinnacle achievement of the visual-novel genre.

Muv Luv Alternative is a deconstruction of an often trite genre. It's not really the most original concept in the world but it is probably the best it's ever been executed. Unfortunately MLA is a pretty hard sell for a lot of people since its predecessor (Muv Luv) can feel pretty sluggish, and is absolutely required in order to get the full experience that Alternative has to offer. If you can't sit through 15ish hours of exposition, you might want to look in another direction. But needless to say, if you're still on board by the time you get to Alternative, you won't be disappointed. This is the #1 rated VN of all time for a damn good reason, and it deserves to be far more popular than it actually is. If you're even a little bit curious, just take the leap. MLA isn't just good on its own--it even goes back and makes Extra/Unlimited better than they initially were, which adds to their replay values as well.

You know that part of the description that says, "Common side effects include... unrealistic expectations for any and all other visual novels"? 

It's accurate.

Sidenote: if you complete and enjoy Alternative, look into the Altered Fable fandisc as well, which includes a turn based, tactical SRPG kinda game set in the universe of Alternative. It's a lot of fun if you spend 30-60 minutes to figure it all out, and it has a lot of heart put into its design to keep everything as true to the source material as possible. Here's to hoping that Degica and Age can translate and bring all the fandiscs over here sooner than later.

36009320.review:
终于通关了。应该说无愧于galgame顶点之作的评价，游戏整体素质非常高。
剧情方面，游戏背景是惯常的地外虫族入侵，然后人类造机甲开始打仗。虽然机战部分并非本作重点，但是战略战术以及敌人、战术机的设计方面都相当用心。而游戏最大的亮点就在于人物塑造。游戏中花费了大量的篇幅用于描写男主的成长过程，让男主在各种事件中变得更加成熟。而其他角色间复杂的矛盾关系以及各自的战斗理由都张力十足，形象都相当丰满。剧情逻辑而言绝大部分内容都能自洽，作者对宏大的世界观驾驭能力出色。然而唯一败笔在于最末一战，明明理应是最高潮的地方，却竟然让我有一种“李云龙，你是不是男人，向我开炮啊”的既视感，实属虎头蛇尾。而且作者政治思想表露的很明显，游戏中能比较明显的感受到作者的右翼以及军国主义倾向。然而瑕不掩瑜，总体而言本作剧情是极其出色的。
画面方面，毕竟是十几年前的老游戏了，画风和分辨率都让人有点难受，但独特的游戏引擎（也是让它兼容性极差，出steam之前安装极其困难的罪魁祸首）带来了极！其！出！众！的表现力，这方面很难详细说，只能进游戏自己体会了。
音乐方面，两首OP都是燃炸的级别，尤其是jam project的未来への咆哮，被用作各种燃向mad的bgm，都不需要多吹，在商店页面第一个视频拖到1分14秒自己感受一下就懂了。（现在单曲循环中）
本游戏含有中度猎奇场面，而且来的非常突兀，请做好被吓到的心理准备。感谢steam的和谐版删掉了触手play的部分，因为即使我推VB系列都能面不改色，但那一段真的太虐了根本受不了。至于Hsence，对于这种画风和剧情，本来也没什么存在必要。

而且这可是官中啊！别的我不敢保证，但这一定是有官中的galgame中最好的游戏，没有之一。不买还是人？？

35843232.review:
很久以前玩的游戏，还记得当时玩过之后心里久久无法平静，一种用震撼也无法形容的心情。是我玩过的最好的gal，开始自学日语的初衷就是为了补muv系列的故事（虽然现在还是半瓶醋水平）。
VNDB评分常年霸占榜首，批评空间全年龄榜单和R18榜单前三的游戏。

这是一篇关于爱与勇气，成长与责任的英雄赞歌。
故事中每一个角色的塑造都非常用心，女主们通过日常的对话和相关的情节塑造出一个个性格迥异的形象，每一个配角也绝不是打酱油的角色，每个人都是有各自故事的有血有肉的人。而全篇塑造最成功的人物莫过于男主白银武。从一开始空有信念却没有与之相对的觉悟，只会为了空泛的“人类胜利”的理想急躁不安，到经历战场的洗礼，无法面对战争的残酷而选择逃避，直到最终找到自己战斗的理由，决心在残酷的现实面前背负起自己的责任，他内心成长变化的过程会让每个玩家感同身受。这个长着路人脸的男主是我个人最喜欢的gal男主，非常亲切，同时有极强的人格魅力。

在无情的战争面前，并没有什么人想要成为救世主，也没有谁战斗的理由仅仅是为了人类的胜利，每个人都背负着不同的责任。支撑人们战斗的信念很简单，只是不愿看到亲人、恋人、战友在自己的面前死去，所以每个人都能笑着奔赴战场，献出生命。生者甚至来不及记住死者的姓名，只能背负着死者的愿望和信念继续前行，把他们的所作所为代代传颂下去。而为了各自信念的一个个“人”的战斗，最终会将世界导向“人类”的胜利。

如果之前玩过无印篇，会对几位女主的人物形象有更深刻的认识，也会在AL一开场就体会到一种与之前完全不同的紧张节奏。AL从头到尾剧情都十分紧凑，前面的故事是男主成长的过程，填了前作的一些坑，引出了更多的配角形象。最后的几场战斗则是高潮迭起，一浪高过一浪，燃到极致，泣到极点。一句“不要小看人类”，让我体会到生而为人是一件多么值得骄傲的事情。
死力尽职，生即尽善，绝不白死！我们只愿，诸位的奋身，能为一个无需把年轻人送上战场的世界，奠下坚实的基石！

写的有些乱，还有很多想说却说不知道如何去表达的话。总之，感谢Muv-Luv带给我的感动。


在这里补充一下，游戏全流程大概40小时多一点，选项只会对对话和结局的极少情节产生影响，并没有多路线。steam重制版非常良心，画质就不说了，在剧情上把一些不自然的地方做出了微调，配音也把一些奇怪的日式英语换成了地道的英美口音，如此大的文字量自带简体中文还基本没有别字的病句（反正我没找到）。我只想说，小吉，Muv-Luv系列你都这样搞，出一部我买一部。

35808086.review:
I genuinely don't think I can find the words to describe this masterpiece.... Honestly, explaining any of the story would be a major spoiler, so I'll start with this: you must complete muv-luv extra, and muv-luv unlimited to get the full impact of this story, the more routes you do in happy happy joy joy land the more this will make sense in the long run....

That said, my god, where muv-luv was a 7/10 romcom of kek proportions, this is a 10/10 masterpiece, and the best visual novel I have ever read (previously being Steins;Gate)... Don't just take it from me, it's also the #1 VN on VNDB [basically the myanimelist for VN's] skirting above steins;gate (and only two vn's in existence have a score above 9, you can count 8's on 1 page too,) so that score is truly meaningful.

I really don't want to delve into any specifics, not even the first minutes of the game, because even the starting moment of this game is a huge surprise... And it just never stops, non stop forward-moving narrative ensures there's never a dull moment... I was truly enthralled by every moment in here, it doesn't feel like there was much of any wasted time/filler(aside from a few flashbacks that might happen way too often, honestly my only gripe,) the way it incorporates the elements from the prequels is done in a way to make all the buildup incredibly worth it, and the end experience of the whole package is astounding. 

If you ever have 100~ hours to commit, and you're okay with a b movie romcom start (again, I'd rate 7/10... To me, that's good. good enough to get through it and I enjoyed it, unlimited is definitely a lot better in that regard, probably give that 8/10, I'd recommend them on their own to people who are alright with slightly whacky slice of life/[spoiler]isekai[/spoiler] genre and what not, but probably not to any random joe.) then you ABSOLUTELY have to give this a try! All that time spent in extra/unlimited will feel well worth the investment once you reach the starting moments of alternative, and it never stops giving til the very last moment.



On another note, If you can't handle [spoiler]incredibly stressful depression/gore/ptsd inducing moments, and you just want to end with the happy feelings of the original, you may actually want to stray away from this. It goes reaaaaaal deep into shit.[/spoiler]

35764894.review:
I believe that visual novels should be able to stand up on their own regardless of what their sequels have planned. Muv-Luv Alternative has made it incredibly hard for me to stick with that belief because, to be honest, if every series had a conclusion like this one I would forgive just about anything. As far as I’m concerned, this particular finale is the ultimate visual novel experience due to the sheer quality of its writing and story. Every single one of those forum-goers recommending the Muv-Luv series because of Alternative is right in a way few people will ever be.

Often when I finish a really good story I fleetingly wonder whether any future experience could possibly match it. With Muv-Luv Alternative, this has become a legitimate concern.

35759611.review:
Осень - сезон грусти и тоски. Подстать этому настроению у нас появилась Muv-Luv Alternative - визуальная новелла с наивысшим рейтингом VNDB за все время. Это тяжелая игра. Она бросит вас в такую бездну отчаяния, выбираться из которой предстоит очень долго. 

Сюжет о безнадежной борьбе человечества за выживание катком проедет по вашим чувствам. Здесь героев нет, а если вы думаете, что сможете стать им - получите очень жестокий урок. Когда кажется, что хуже уже быть не может, выясняется - еще как может. 
Это уникальное, не ограничиенное жанровыми клише произведение, которое не боится показывать всю правду. Война жестока, и вы на своей шкуре, без всякой пощады, перенесете это снова и снова.

Атмосферу игры в высокой мере определяют полностью озвученные диалоги и просто шедевральный саундтрек, который написали гениальные люди. Такой глубины и разнообразия музыкальных композиций я нигде прежде не встречал. И вот уже спустя год после прочтения я до сих пор ими заслушиваюсь.

Я рекомендую серию Muv-Luv. Но нужно для себя решить - готовы ли вы к этому. Если да - то не пожалеете об этом.

35755445.review:
内涵大量剧透，请谨慎观看。

从各种角度上来说不能算是游戏，而是电子小说，选项不会影响主线，只会影响最后对5人小队的感情。
第一遍自然是冥夜结局，结果发现有4个遗书，因此不得不从小麻死后选找人安慰的地方读档重新选人，然后快随跳过所有已读文字直通结局，结果就是那么的小麻死了四次，听了那边的夕月老师嘴炮+BGM，听了若本爷4次站前宣言，看了轨道驱逐舰队当了4次团灭的肉盾以及看冥夜最后的遗言四次。

要评论Alternative就不得不提及作为铺垫的Extra和Unlimited。
如果一个个来看，Extra就是一个夸张搞笑风格的日常后宫Galgame，包括小分支选项影响情感，最后影响个人结局，在大事件主体流程不变的情况下因为触发了不同人的事件，导致最后走进不同人的结局，算是比较正常的Galgame了。游戏一开始的基调就是那种搞笑画风的，某些搞笑风格的动画CG配合着BGM也特别符合这种氛围，而且人物立绘配合着故事进行移动、变化也很有意思。几个缺点的话，只能说一个是CG质量和人物立绘上感觉不够精美（不过也是老游戏了吧），然后剧情也不能说很有亮点。

Unlimited的话则感觉彻底沦为铺垫——主角他们训练了半天一直都没上战场，BATE铺垫了半天只漏了几个剪影。可以说除了一直强调他们是军人，每天要早起训练，吃的是合成食物之后，我甚至感觉这是一个Extra的裂化版，一个没有单人故事线，只有角色情感影响最终结局选择（大同小异）的Extra。PS：为了通全结局，需要先按照特地选择导致结局时所有人的选项全开，然后一个个选，每个人还都要在最终选择送她去外太空和留在地球两种，因此你不得不听武爷唠叨11遍（还需要加上夕月老师结局（没错））。
如果没有最后Alternative的出场，我觉得Unlimited甚至是会留下骂名的作品——5个女主角只有班长、小珠和慧的部分的个人背景得到了揭露，纯夏只出现在回忆中，社霞谜团没有解开，以及只在开头和最后提及的Alternative计划。Unlimited的流程基本上就是先进行基本的世界观介绍，介绍这个世界5个女主角的情况，然后通过事件，让女主角们和主角互动——演戏篇是美琴，HSST事件是小珠，天元山是冥夜，分队模拟训练是班长和彩峰。最后在一切看似顺利的时候，如果让剧情急转直下：先是铺垫基地很忙，导致主角们很闲，然后又在圣诞节的时候，在男主选择好女主，大家（不明真相的观众）感觉正Happy的时候，突然宣布Alternative4（虽然大家不知道这是啥）失败，基地解散，给人一种无力感。毕竟主角他们是一没信息二没实力的训练兵，空有报国救世的热情，缺也只能随波逐流。

最后就是Alternative篇了，一开场先是0gravity，接着是期待已久的Jam project的向着未来的咆哮。PS：个人感觉，Jam Project许多机战的歌，听起来旋律不一定像一般摇滚什么的快节奏，但是如果你把情感带入，配合着各式机战MAD实用，你绝对会感到热血沸腾）。Alternative的故事始于主角保留了Unlimited的记忆（但从最后来看，主角可能是进行了多次Unlimi世界线，甚至是Extra结局全通），为了改变Alternative4计划失败而努力。
从主角正常来说，Extra-》Unlimited-》Alternative本身就是白银武从正常世界的平凡人，到为了保护“Unlimited的世界”有所觉悟的训练兵、卫士，再到对Alternative5计划感到愤恨，因为有这样一个机会而打算努力的人。不过，Alternative篇本身也待着白银武进一步的成长历程。故事开篇比较顺利，白银武因为已经是训练了3年的卫士，加上有着在Extra世界的记忆，一方面能够不拖后腿甚至帮助队员进步，另一方面能够开放出新的战术机OS增强战力（然而看结局的意思是樱花大战的时候这个OS可能还没有彻底普及吧）。
但是另外一方面，白银武的心理其实是有点扭曲的——他一味地对自己强调要让Alternative4计划成功，但是从心理素质上，他还只是一个并没有上过战场见过Beta损失过战友的后方卫士（网上搜了一下Unlimited世界其实还有白银武奋战的后续，但是不知道为什么这里Alternative世界的白银武反正应该只有到Alternative5计划启动飞船离开的记忆），他可以无情地拜托夕月老师让士兵强行驱逐天元山的老奶奶来节约时间，安慰自己这是为了全人类，但是面对悠阳，他却无法下手注射镇定剂。换句话来说，他有一个看似坚定的目标，但是他没有真正能够去实现这个目标的觉悟，他能够提供一些信息、情报，但实际上作用有限——真正起作用的一个是新OS（配合他玩巴尔加农的经验是的他成为技术一流的卫士），一个是他自身从别的世界穿越过来的特性以及他那个世界的夕月老师以及完成了一个重要理论的事实，最后一个是他和纯夏的关系（这个是最后才起作用的）。
因为可能是因为天元山事件改变而触发的日本政变事件让白银武反思自己的行动方式，而之后的演戏惨案则考验这白银武作为卫士的觉悟，最终几乎自暴自弃的白银武逃回了“原本的世界”。而最后白银武作为因果导体的特质和发生在“原本的世界”小麻、纯夏身上的事情成为了压垮他的最后一根稻草——无处可逃，留在这个世界可能导致50亿人的死亡，唯有回到Alternative的世界探寻自己成为因果导体的原因才有一丝救赎的希望。
然而成熟过来的白银武却依旧面对着各种冲击——这个世界的纯夏其实就是以前看到的脑子，是失去人类情感00单元；好不容易看到希望的凄乃皇却突然瘫痪（而且似乎是因为纯夏嫉妒白银武对冥夜的H回忆）导致刚刚遇到的值得信任的长官和战友牺牲）；好不容易和纯夏确认感情，结果Beta突袭基地，各种伤亡；最终虽然击毁了Beta的主脑，但是后宫团基本全灭，回来的纯夏也塞了一个反正一定会死，索性这次力竭而死的便当）。
整个故事从演戏惨案开始，才算是真正的展现了被Beta入侵的世界的绝望——无论是新OS还是过饱和攻击，都抵不过Beta的数量，而且这其实还是Beta并没有把人类当做“敌人”的状态下。卫士们的惨死更是家常便饭。在平时开着各种玩笑的人们内心其实都藏着无尽的痛苦，即使如此，还是要继续战斗。
总的来说，Alternative为我们展现了一个在绝望中为了希望奋斗的故事，一个背负着数个世界希望而不断成长努力的少年，一群为了守卫心爱之物而义无反顾踏上战场的战士。


最后，不管质量如何，强烈要求出最后有冥夜双胞胎+社霞的正常世界的GAL啊
在PS一下，没有单独听BGM的地方要给差评啊

35737012.review:
不要问了，[h1]买。 [/h1]系好安全带。
steam花的最值的212元，Muv-luv+Muv-luv Alternative捆绑包现在还打九折【。
剧情上想说的有很多，不过这种剧透我就不在这里宣泄太多了。[strike]听OST去了.jpg。[/strike]

这是应当每一个文字游戏爱好者都体会一下的————



	[h1]一个名叫白银武的男人在黑暗中战斗，自我成长，逐渐寻求到自己真正要走的路和守护心爱之物的故事。 [/h1]


剧本对话的代入感，成长感把握的太到位了。对读者玩家的心理也拿捏的很准，无数次无数次被编剧想传达给我的话狠狠扎心，实在厉害。不知不觉自己的理解，心态和三观都随着剧情和男主的内心开始转变了。这点让我自己也是很惊讶，只能说真是nb的编剧，nb的心理戏掌控力。

台词可以说是 点到为止 写实走心了，话不多说然而一个简单的词汇就能让整个角色瞬间立体，情感得到升华。角色的面部表情演出也是非常丰富。
将军这角色，台词没几句，说的几句想表达的深度贯穿全游，男主当时并没有懂她想说的真正意思，直至经历了各种各样，才在心里反复回忆念想。成长戏心理戏到位得不行，一边玩一边吹。


章数过半开始剧情才爆炸起来[spoiler] 小麻不要啊 [/spoiler]
，一路过山车，爽的我睡不着。只想来一章，再来一章……

最后两章	[h1]燃，泣，郁[/h1]发挥到了极致。剧透看了不少了，心理准备也有了。最终章还是没忍住，眼泪掉下来了。对着画面afk哭了一会儿。

演出效果100/10，人类的赞歌，就是勇气的赞歌！！燃得燃烧灵魂了，声优们出色的演技，燃尽一切对未来和命运的嘶吼听得我热泪盈眶。


这才是真正 [h1]花了心思打磨，精益求精，触动人心，让人成长的好作品。 [/h1]


感谢在横滨基地陪伴着我，还有一起战斗过的所有人，真的很谢谢你们，自以为已经很成熟的我最后还是让你们那么担心，受到了你们那么多的照顾。
[strike]某些H要素太刻意突兀了，要减分！虽然制作方也有自己的理由能够理解，还是减分！![/strike]
 [strike] 就算是自己也不能给这个游戏打任何减分项所以划掉 [/strike]

因为失去而坚强。

35626417.review:
Souvent, pour résumer une histoire, on peut dire qu'elle nous a fait l'effet d'une claque. Gardez cette image en tête, et dites vous qu'avec Muv-Luv Alternative, c'est plutôt de l'ordre du semi remorque qui vous roule dessus (plusieurs fois).

Première chose, c'est je pense très important de jouer aux deux opus précédents, Muv-Luv Extra et Unlimited. Le principal intérêt est l'attachement aux personnages. Ca peut paraître secondaire (surtout quand on connait peu les visuals novels), mais cela risque de faire toute la différence entre une bonne expérience et une expérience mémorable, puisque les personnages sont un des très gros point fort de ce VN. Les filles de l'unité de départ, Yuuko Sensei, Marimo, Kasumi, Tsukuyomi, le héros principal et l'unité A01 sont tous très bien construits et donnent vraiment envie de voir la suite.

J'en dirais peu sur l'histoire, car c'est vraiment dur de l'évoquer sans vraiment tout spoiler, mais c'est un autre point fort d'Alternative. En toute franchise, en ayant lu Extra et Unlimited, je ne m'attendais pas du tout à une histoire aussi aboutie. Et même si j'ai bien aimé les deux, Alternative est vraiment d'un tout autre niveau. En plus, j'ai vraiment adoré l'immersion, tout est fait pour qu'on se prenne pour Takeru et ça fonctionne terriblement bien. La bande son aussi est très bien faite, ce n'est pas la meilleur de l'histoire de l'humanité mais certaines BGM sont vraiment géniales (War Preparation, For You Who Departs / Destiny, Storm Vanguard, Flame of Life pour ne citer que celles-ci).

Ensuite, pour ceux qui se poserait la question, le fait que les scènes "olé olé" ne soient pas présentes dans cette version ne change pas grand chose à l'expérience, car contrairement à certaines traductions censurés faites n'importe comment (coucou If My Heart Had Wings), ici les traducteurs ont fait un excellent travail et rien n'est enlevé à l'histoire. Après il faut savoir comprendre l'anglais, évidemment, et c'est pas donné à tout le monde.

En résumé, un VN juste génial, réussi sur quasiment tout les aspects et sûrement l'un des meilleurs disponible sur steam actuellement ; l'un des meilleurs tout court en fait.


Pour ceux qui aiment bien chercher la petite bête, j'ai listé quelques points négatifs. Après faut garder à l'esprit que c'est de l'ordre du détail :
_ les visuels datent un peu et la résolution n'est pas très élevée, compréhensible vu la date originale de sortie (2006).
_ je sais que ça peut en déranger certains de voir des personnages avec des coiffures wtf en pleine guerre contre des extraterrestres, mais bon en vrai on n'y fait plus attention assez vite et ce n'est pas choquant quand on connait un minimum les mangas, animes, etc.
_ certaines longueurs lors des phases plus calmes de l'histoire peuvent là aussi en gêner quelques-uns. J'ai personnellement adoré, mais c'est vrai que Takeru parle et réfléchi beaucoup.
_ une fois le jeu terminé, il n'est pas possible d'écouter à nouveau les BGMs, assez étrange vu que c'était possible dans Extra et Unlimited.
_ ATTENTION SPOIL [spoiler] Le fait que l'histoire soit linéaire, sans choix vraiment important m'a un poil déçu, étant fan du personnage de Meiya. Sumika est vraiment la fille qui compte le plus ici. C'est justifié par toute l'intrigue en elle-même et donc c'est plutôt logique, mais ça m'a quelques fois fait perdre en immersion en ayant trop Unlimited en tête. [/spoiler]


(Quand je repense au fait que j'ai passé presque 70 heures en une semaine devant un livre interactif datant de 2006 ... ils sont forts ces japonais quand même)

35575364.review:
As a human being, i'm always searching for feeling something in games, excitement, sad, happiness, but after all this journey, since Extra, going through Unlimited and finally finished Alternative, i can say that i felt everything, happiness, sadness, hype, horror, proud, and that is the testament of something as good as Muv-Luv Alternative.

Muv-Luv Alternative is one of a kind, you'll never find anything like it in every other entertainment area, the writting is so good, there isnt any flaw in a sense of, everything will be explained, the most absurd thing, to the most basic. For me, what makes a good story are good characters, and every single one of those characters in Muv-Luv are memorable, sometimes i felt like a father figure seeing your children growing up to become a adult, every character mature, they still have flaws, but seeing everyone change to the point of you not recognize what they were in Extra, this is a good writting, you think you know what is going to happen, and you probably are going to be right on the money, but you'll never expect how things going to happen. 

As i see with a critic perspective, have to say, i think this is one of, if not the best VN of all time, and i can say for sure it is better then every single game story out there these days, it gives valuable lessons that we overlook in our life, what we take for granted, what we fight for as human beings, and what maturing actually means, what needs to be done, those are questions that i'll carry through my life thanks to this VN, as well as every character and mainly Takeru, as i mention earlier, it is like a father seeing his children growing up, you see his hardship, his low moments, he is just a human being besides being what he is, and i think that's why he is so commendable, every time he felt, i felt as well, every time he was happy i was, when he did something great i was proud of him, it is so weird that a game that is basically text, audio and images can make you feel spectrum of feelings. 

At the end of the day, Muv-Luv Alternative is right beside Clannad in my heart, i'll never forget what they teached me, the moments, the characters, the music, everything, the action scenes you want to throw your table through the window just for the insane hype, the horror moments and traumatizing moments my blood ran cold, the heart felt moments i just felt as it was one of my own, there is a reason why therapy is not included, because i'm traumatize for life.

35306724.review:
Firstly. 
If you haven't bought or read the previous chapters, namely Muv-Luv (Extra & Ultimate) you need to stop, go get them and read those first.
Extra is a little "silly" and for some might be a put off because the tone it sets is very lighthearted and a little too much over the top with teenage situations but it is require as the ammount of foreshadowing and context it creates sets up for Ultimate (when stuff really gets thrown for a loop) and brings Muvluv Alternative to a grand finale. 

Also while it only shows that I had 38+ hours I have read this VN previously having access to the uncensored Japanese version from several years back so its closer to about 250hrs having re-read the VN several times over.

For those who are worried that this censored version would not be as impactful or just want the lewds, seriously, its very minor and are missing only a few key scenes but not so much that you totally miss out on what actually happened [spoiler] (intimacies between Takeru and Sumika) and yes, they had sex [/spoiler] that you can't tell what happened or totally removed like with Nekopara.

To date I have read this trilogy  more times than I can count  covering all routes and rereading it over the years so I definitely have spent more then 600hrs total on this VN series alone. 
There's a reason for that.
Muvluv is one of the best if not the best Visual Novel in story, visuals and sound back when it realese more than a decade ago at 2003 and Alternative at 2006 and still till today held up well, while not as smothly animated as some of the new VNs, or as crisp in visuals when compared to todays CG scenes, Muvluv tells a far better story than many VNs since its release and I have read far too many VNs over the years. 

In short Muvluv is about life, love, sacrifice and the nature of the human heart and it tells that story very well.

You had your fun in you games and your harem everyday life, even with the world invaded by aliens you still fell in love, got a girl and played soldier.

Remember how powerless you felt when you abandoned what you held dear? If you could rewind back time to change that, how far would you be willing to go? How much could you give up?

The time for fun and games is over, you now have your final chance, but fair warning. War was never meant for the weak of heart. Once you start there is no turning back.

Review Start: the paragraph above best describes how I would introduce someone to MLA, you see people say this VN is a masterpiece , the best but also always see PTSD, pain train, depression and the like. The two are one and the same thing, this game is not for the weak of heart we got extra and unlimited for that. You loved the characters in Muvluv? Good! You love the TSFs? Great! Felt weird not seeing the gravity of the situation? Well steel you resolve soldier. Now you go for a REAL war that you wanted since unlimited but unlike other games you dont have plot armor to save you. The only game that punishes dedication and attachment to characters. Where you will feel what a real war is, you are but a single soldier, you honestly believe a protagonist can go hero and overturn a war? Well good luck and see if you can. That experience is what the MLA trilogy is all about.

With a compelling narative and engaginng story, experience what the hype is all about. The VN that raised over a million dollars that fact alone describes how much people love this game. My self included. You can believe we are crazy, you can believe you are superior for not following the hype. But this game would not have the love and support it has without being able to touch so many lives.

Recommend this to anyone feeling that you are insignificant and weak, powerless or depressed. This game would show you the finest and ugliest traits of humanity and make you believe that there are things worth dying for.

PS, this aint no game, no amount of yelling about doing you best would save you, no amount of belief can overturn the beta. To everyone who read MLA and are still innocent, you have my respect brothers and sisters, We tried.

Pro: Possibly one of the best stories ever told in any media.

Con: Probably requires you to read Extra, possibly one of the worst stories ever told in any media...

(Yeah, i hated it that much. Especially Sumikas character design...)

All in all I advise to completely skip Extra and just go to Unlimited. The story/relationships are self explanatory anyway. You might miss out on the so called nostalgia or hidden premonition effects, but if you don't like Extra anyway (like me), it actually makes Alternative much worse in some parts if you had to force yourself through Extra by adding some negative emotional baggage and therefore just outright rejecting some story parts and developments in Alternative. As I don't want to spoiler, I won't go into detail there. I've made the mistake to force myself through one route in Extra believing it would make it better in retrospect. I was wrong... I am absolutely sure I would've enjoyed Alternative far more if not for those negative memories of browsing though the, pardon me, retarded world of Extra, of which you get reminded of in Alternative as the story progresses. 

You might ask yourself why I don't really touch on Unlimited here. The reason is, that Alternatives storyline has far more Interaction with Extra, and therefore bad memories of Extra don't surface much through Unlimited, but do it with a bang when you hit Alternative. 

If you don't like Extra after about an hour of reading, just stop and move on to Unlimited. 
You have been warned...

This review is spoiler free and DONT READ ANYTHING ABOUT THIS GAME, OR MAKE ABSOLUTELY SURE ANYTHING YOU READ IS SPOILER FREE. If you think "Naaah, it can't that bad, I've been spoiled before, im used to it" Let me you tell you this, if you screw this up, you WILL regret it so much when the moment comes. My friend almost murdered me for spoiling it for him after I experienced that scene and had to tell others about it. I've regretted it ever since. This game is a shining gold nugget that you DO NOT WANT TO DIM

There is one scene which will give you an experience which you will never experience again in your life time and if you ruin it, you WILL regret it so much that you honestly want to go back in time and hit yourself for not being careful in the internet.

Now onto the review.

It's the best of the english translated Visual novels right now and I mean THE BEST. It's been at the top of VNDB most rated and popular visual novels since... I started reading visual novels ten years ago? Anyway, a long time

How to say it shortly... This game delves into the original Muv Luv's Unlimited story ark world, so it's huge plus if you've read the previous title, as you will understand more about the world you're plunged into. Visual novel is centered around alternative telling of our world and its post apocalyptic world and the problems that rise from it. If you've read the previous title Unlimited story ark you can probably surmise that this is a far cry from the love comedy genre that original Muv Luv was.

Im not going to tell you anything more than that, because well... You really have to experience it yourself.

Now then this story has incredible soundtrack, story, characters, drama, character development, lore, voice actors, world politics. I honestly cannot think any "bad" things about this game. It's just so good that you just either don't notice them or that there isn't any.

Only "bad" thing about this game is that it's LONG and I mean LOOOOONG. It took me a WEEK (probably longer, I can't remember) to read the damn thing (I can't remember clearly but I think I read atleast 4-8 hours a day, give or take some breaks doing something else) and during that week, I felt like I was in HIIIIGH heaven. Probably exaggeration but one thing is for sure, this visual novel will break your mind.

For me, a visual novel being long is a good thing if the reading is exciting and captivating. For some people it's bad a thing, they probably want to do something else than spend whole day reading a book you cannot stop reading. This visual novel is one of the rare visual novel's that keep surprising you with "It didn't end here? It's still going on? HELL YEAH" and when you're finally at the end you feel drained and depressed that the thing you've read has ended.

So to close this all up.

Make absolutely sure not to spoil yourself about this game and prepare a LOT of time to read this, preferable alone at some summer cottage during weekends in middle of nowhere where noone can disturb you.

35199457.review:
I have now played through this visual novel 3 times, and I still manage to laugh and cry as much as the first time I read it. The story covers so many different topics that I don't think it's possible to really put it into a genre. As much as people will tell you that you need to read the first ones, I've already lost so many potential readers to the monotony of the first two games. But as almost every person that has gone through the journey of the three games will tell you, the payoff is insanely worth it. It's got more action, strategic tension, and plot twists than Code Geass. The characters and the world that you're thrust into contain personality, grit, and lore that simply can't be found in anime with time and dialogue constraints. But the visual novel also never forgets to make you laugh and make connections with the people struggling with you. At the risk of sounding like a complete tool, I think Muv Luv Alternative has the best story that any Japanese medium has to offer. 

The new translation is an improvement off the fan translation overall, and many of the physics concepts that are explained throughout the novel are easier to understand as a result. Sex scenes still exist in this version, with the images zoomed in and edited to avoid showing any nudity. I do not imagine that this will impact the experience of many readers. Only the most explicit of dialogue is cut, and Sekai Project clearly made an effort to stay faithful to the original as much as possible with the limitations of Steam. Also, English vocals are thankfully much improved from the original. As such, I don't think it's necessary to go through the trouble of patching the game to 18+. 

The production values on this visual novel are incredible in some aspects, and mediocre in others. Many people do not like the art style of the characters, but the animation quality of the action sequences and the broad set of facial expressions that come with the art style more than make up for it for me.

I'm going to be one of the dissenting opinions and tell you that if you have a history of dropping shows after the first few episodes bore you, then maybe you should just skip straight to Muv-Luv Unlimited. This will severely degrade the experience, but even this degraded experience is amazing by itself, and most of the foreshadowing and flashbacks in Alternative refer to Muv-Luv Unlimited. Though Muv-Luv Extra and Unlimited combined are shorter than Alternative, this doesn't change the fact that Extra by itself can take 15-20 hours of your time, and is notoriously generic and boring for those seeking a strong story and tension. 

I'm bad at conclusions.

35197489.review:
I had very mixed feelings about both backing and playing Muv-Luv, especially Alternative. Through a combination of my own curosity and hubris, and various discussion forums posting open spoilers, I had several major plot points of Alternative ruined for me. This included virtually all of the revelations from the final hour or so of the novel.

As a result, I believed I was somewhat prepared for what awaited me, and charged headlong into what has been one of the most emotional experiences of my life. Rather ironic, really, considering what happens through the course of Takeru's journey.

Maybe 20 minutes ago, the credits for Alternative scrolled past my screen. Rather than try to piece my psyche back together enough to write a coherent review, I'll just say this:

The last time I openly cried, not counting the occassional sob, was when my parents died nearly 20 years ago. The events leading up to the finale of Muv-Luv Alternative brought me to the brink, and the final scenes let loose a torrent comparable to that horrible day all those years ago.

A true masterwork of the medium. I cannot recommend it enough.

35193959.review:
Easily the best visual novel I've played, and one of the best mecha-genre pieces of media I've ever experienced. As someone who's obsessed with this genre, this isn't something I say lightly.

It's an emotional rollercoaster with a real mind-bender of a plot that never ceases to surprise. It constantly kept me guessing and was constantly catching me off guard, especially as it really doesn't pull any punches whatsoever.

The only real caveats are that the prior game isn't really an option to skip, and that the amount of input the player gets seems to be somewhat less here than those prior chapters (which in my opinion is made up for by the fact that this is easily the hardest-hitting chapter of the story.) Most off-putting of all is probably the asking price, although I got over thirty-five hours out of it, and despite it hardly being interactive at all, that time was compelling enough that it kept me going until the early hours of the morning sometimes.

Despite those hangups I really can't recommend this highly enough, this entire story was just a remarkable ride.

35164035.review:
A month ago I was convinced that visual novels were a waste of time.

But then I discovered that Muv-Luv had been released on Steam.  I'd been interested in trying this series for a long time because I'd seen figures of the mecha and they were really cool so I thought I'd give it a shot.

Muv-Luv was an epic awakening that there was value to this medium.  I laughed.  I sobbed uncontrollably.  And I eagerly awaited this sequel.

Muv-Luv Alternative loops time again after the end of Ultimate bringing closure to the events in the Ultimate time-line and answering many of the things that were left unexplained and mysterious:  Where is Sumika?  What's the deal with Alternative IV?  Who is and what is the deal with Kasumi?  Will Takeru ever grow up?  How can you have so little mecha action in a story about mecha?

This visual novel is considerably more linear than even Ultimate which might put you off if you are expecting gameplay, but that is not the point of a visual novel.  The story is long, satisfying, profoundly upsetting and occasionally horrifying.  If you like mecha, there's a heck of a lot of mecha.  By the end you will feel the wear and the strain of the campaign.  You will mourn friends lost.  You may still... hate Takeru, but trust me you will love everyone else.

This visual novel has been a truly incredible use of 29 hours of my life.  I'm so glad that there's been a western release so I could experience it.

Time to buy a truly astounding number of mech figures!

35140554.review:
I can see why this game is regarded as being somewhere around God-tier. This game completely erases the tones set up in the previous two games in the series, Muv Luv and Muv Luv Extra. The original Muv Luv, as you should know by now, was more like your typical dating sim visual novel, where a good majority of the girls are attracted to you and you have the choice of dating whichever one you choose. Extra took this a bit further, and added a more deep tone to it, while having that dating sim aspect still present. But then you have this game. Muv Luv Alternative. They took the design of the other two novels and literally threw them out of the TSF straight into the mouths of a Fort-class BETA. The carefree attitude of the MC Shirogane Takeru is annihilated, as he suffers similarly to Okabe Rintarou in Steins;Gate. The suffering never ends, and you get dragged through the mud and blood right along with Takeru as he stumbles and falls, but also while he learns to accept reality and face what he's been running away from this whole time. Of course, this is already along the lines of being spoiler, so I'll leave it at that.

This game in particular completely threw me off. I was expecting to be able to have some fun and lighthearted adventures as Takeru comes back for his 3rd installment in the series. Of course, if you read the store description, you immediately know that something went very wrong this time around. You have to watch the suffering, watch the pain and despair, and you can't do anything to help as you are merely the observer. It's painful. It may give you borderline PTSD for a while. Every happy moment seems like it could very well break any moment, it's actually rather stressful as well. You get enveloped in the chaotic world of humans being at war with the aliens known as BETA and it pulls your attention even stronger the deeper you dive into it. The science is real, the reality is actually rather realistic. There's no magical powers, no plot armor. Every threat is real, nobody is safe. That's war. The tech is more advanced sure, but you get explanations for nearly everything that is used, and it all makes sense. This visual novel is Legendary. Truly God-tier. You do need to walk through the first two games to get that deeper connection with the characters, but it's worth it. Play this game, you seriously need to experience this story. It's on a level of its own.

35139488.review:
Well worth the full price, the game is upwards of 20 hours of well written story and characters with each of their own backstories and motivations.  There's a reason its one of the best rated visual novels out there, it still is one of the best even more than 10 years after it's initial release.

If you have not played Muv-Luv and Muv-Luv: Unlimited, I would reccomend doing so before playing this game.  The choices you made in those games do not carry over, but they set up the characters and some key plot points, and Alternative has an interesting way of making every choice you make on those two games canon.

35133946.review:
2017.9.19第一时间steam入手，体验官中，经历4天时间通关extra，unlimited和alternative。
全篇无剧透，可以放心食用。

评价如下：
+令人惊艳的rUGP引擎何其所带来的画面表现力。
由于该引擎，本作与传统的CG，立绘的galgame表现手法不一样，给人带来了丰富的视觉盛宴。要知道这可是2006年的游戏，即使放到今天来看表现力也不落后。

+角色丰富的表情以及参与度。当画面中出现多角色时，可以看到未说话角色的表情变化，十分微妙和有趣。此外，即使角色们互相说话未和主角对话，有时也以背景出现并可以看到表情变化。

+大量类似电影的表现手法使用赋予了剧本极大张力，尤其体现在本作的战斗情节中。

+该作的角色塑造功力上佳，配角十分出彩，并没有其他世界系作品中只有男女主角大放异彩的情况出现。alternative全作中各种队友和上下级均能给人留下深刻印象，体现出了群像感。

+官中汉化以及对Win10的支持。
这点很关键，由于rGUP引擎的特殊性，本作的盗版安装极为麻烦（号称安装堪比ANSYS的galgame）而且不支持Win10，所以Win10用户和嫌麻烦的老年用户建议购买正版。

+本作塑造了一个比女主角还有魅力的男主角。

-汉化有些过于“接地气”，梗和口语出现太多，有时过于意译，对待翻译给人一种贾秀琰在银河护卫队中的表现的感觉，但毕竟不是专业翻译，可以接受。

-该作含有日本右翼思想和对昭和日本历史的影射，可能会引起不适或吐槽。

-该作的相关设定和世界观的政治军事部分可能会引发认真人士的吐槽。

-警告：该作含有极度血腥猎奇情节以及CG，很有可能引起不适或极度不适。该作含有触手NTR情节，可能引起不适或极度不适。

特别提醒：要进入alternative篇才能体验本作精髓，但在此之前必须先忍受extra篇的日常，建议在打通鉴纯夏线路和御宫冥夜线路后进入unlimited篇。extra篇可以适度快进。

评价：9分（满分10分）

Actual review:

Don't be fooled by the harem theme. It was actually a bait to lure weak people in, and then crush their hopes with the ultimate despair.

Muv-Luv Alternative makes a really good sequel of Muv-Luv by bringing you characters you are familiar with in Muv-Luv, but deepens the characters and emotions. Each girls has their own personality, their own stories, their own worries, their own reason, and their own...love. People usually portray girls as weakling who should be protected and saved in war, but in this game, the girls are the one doing the protecting.

People might say this is a sad story, but you can think whatever. To me, this is a story about growing up. From the happy-go-lucky life in original Muv-Luv, suddenly everything changes and you are forced to face so many things to the breaking point. From each arc, each dialogue with all the characters I learned how small my problems were, I learned how to deal with my emotions, I learned how to endure, and how to give my best effort to face adversity. To know that I'm not the only one with issues, to know that everyone is struggling far worse and they manage to stay strong, I realized that I need to move forward too. For my sake and for their sake.

This game helped me grow up.

Characters: 10/10
Music: 9.5/10
Story: 9.5/10
Art: 8/10
I didn't cry: 13/10

I don't really have anything else to say with out getting into story specifics, so I'll simply end by saying that I absolutely recommend this game. Though if you played the first two you really shouldn't need convinceing to buy this one.

35111222.review:
While I may not have much time listed for the game, it's because I played the fan translated version years ago and knew in my heart it was worth the $40 to support an official one now even if I had no intention of reading it again due to length. As far as VNs go, MLA is just, well, really really long. It's about as long as all 3 F/SN routes combined for comparison to other visual novels - it will probably take the average user around 60 hours minimum to read it. So why invest all that time in it? Because it's worth it. MLA is [b]the best[/b] visual novel I have read to date. Somehow against all odds, a crappy generic school harem spun off into an amazing apocalyptic sci-fi story.  It's a story filled with violence, despair, and sacrifice but the core theme of not giving up no matter how dark it looks for the hope of a better tomorrow is stong throughout, and to see the character's journey to completion is an experience I will never forget. 

However not every diamond is without its flaws. Alternative's comes in the form of its predecessors, Extra and Unlimited. These... aren't great. Extra is a generic school harem as previously mentioned, and while Unlimited is the source of the spinoff that Alternative follows up, it was kind of mediocre. If MLA is a 10, E and U would be a 5 and 6 repsectively. Now, as much as I'd like to say "you can just skip them", for a story like this you can't. The main routes of E and just one playthrough of U are required - I would in no way suggest just reading a synopsis for it. So that's probably 10-15 hours of time you'll have to invest into something not really that good to get to something amazing. It's definitely worth it in the end, so don't let it throw you off and just power thorugh to get to Alternative.

“Intense, Emotional and Terrifying. Muv Luv Alternative is one of the greatest visual novels I've ever read." - Majikoi (MH) 2018

DISCLAIMER: I have personally backed this game on Kickstarter. This is my 2nd review on Steam and will be spoiler free and be more like my ramblings and praise for the series. I have read the visual novel before the release on Steam.

Critically acclaimed by fans and rated #1 on the VNDB. Muv Luv Alternative (pronounced "Mabu Ravu") was released in 2006, 3 years after the release of Muv Luv Extra/Unlimited. Alternative is the final game in the original Muv Luv Trilogy. Completing the story of Shirogane Takeru. A story of "Love and Courage". 

Despite being linear in format, Alternative has a very strong narrative and impressive world building. The first part of the story begins similarly to the start of Unlimited. As the story progresses things start to change dramatically as Takeru's decisions change the world and the future. Elements  such as plot twists, politics, moral/ethical dilenmas litter the 1st half of the story. It is much more grounding and purposeful compared to Unlimited and it finally gives value to a lot of the generic story elements in the first two games.

The 2nd part of the story is where Alternative takes off. And boy, does it take off. Exponentially. The first time I had read it, I went on a 48 hour binge reading spree to complete it. A very emotional, dramatic and powerful experience you only get in a very few selection of visual novels.

Alternative is really a story of sacrifice with love and courage in the mix. Some fans of the series would argue that throughout the later half of the story, Takerus struggles and situations lead him a journery where he grows from a boy to a man. However, I would have to disagree, rather his journey is one where a boy becomes soldier. Dealing with the harsh realities of war in world very different from our own but also very similar. Despite that, it reminds us that there is still hope.

Overall I greatly enjoyed it and is one experience that I probably won't ever forget. I highly reccommend it to anyone that is a fan of science fiction / romance / drama.

"Carry out your mission at all costs!
Fight till your very last breath!
Make your death count!"


BONUS CANADIAN BREAKFAST FOOD REVIEW:

Extra = Uncooked Buttermilk Pancake Batter

Muv Luv Extra is like uncooked pancake batter. Under extreme circumstances, one may consume it raw it if absolutely necessary. Overall, bland and almost unpalatable, but not inedible if you are in a post apocalyptic survival situation.

Unlimited = Hot Non-Stick Skillet

Muv Luv Unlimited is the foundation of Muv Luv and many of its side stories and spinoffs. An absolute and necessary tool for the introduction to the alternative universe of the Muv Luv franchise. Without it, one must consume their foodstuffs raw. When combined with Extra, you get a fluffy, warm, and soft buttermilk pancake. Still bland, but much more palatable.

Alternative = 100% Authentic Real Canadian Grade “A” Maple Syrup

“One cannot have said to have tasted the “TRUE” essence of breakfast pancakes without having it with real Canadian maple syrup...” - Some random Canadian gentleman I happened to interview one day on the street... 

Muv Luv Alternative is like maple syrup. It is the final game in the trilogy and completes the main series in its entirety. Golden and delicious, the naturally sweet syrup when combined with your warm buttermilk pancakes (Extra + Unlimited) completes your amazing morning breakfast. Each mouthful tantalizes your tongue and taste buds. You can't stop and find yourself having breakfast pancakes every morning. Soon you get fat. Your friends tease and bully you. Your mother shames you. Your doctor tells you that you have type 2 diabetes! You later discover that maple syrup is a very poor source of nutrients and very high in sugar/calories. Every drop adds to your waistline... But you don't regret it. Yes. You don't regret it at all.

Side Stories and Spin offs (in Photon Flowers/Melodies, etc) 
= Pancake toppings such as blueberries, apples, jam, chocolate, butter, nuts, etc.

When different toppings are added to your pancake breakfast, it makes each meal unique and enhances the flavor and experience.

The Day After, Total Eclipse, Schwarzesmarken, Altered Fable, etc (Major Side Stories)
 = Bacon, Eggs, Sausage, Ham, and/or Hash Browns.

Major side stories such as The Day After, Total Eclipse, Schwarzesmarken are other delicous breakfast items, that when added to your pancake meal creates a complete and balanced "Breakfast of Champions".

35087733.review:
Personal bias disclaimer: I own every MuvLuv related visual novel prior to Total Eclipse including Chronicles, Haruko Maniax etc.

The conclusion to what is basically the longest single sci-fi visual novel written with Extra and Unlimited basically being both an extremely long prologue and world building chapters. Alternative builds on everything introduced in the two previous installments and then dials it up to eleven. All the character building, all the world building, all those odd little moments that sort of didn't make sense in the context they were presented, ALL of it is relevant so if you enjoyed those aspects and they piqued your interest then you are going to love Alternative.

This version is also far more polished than the fan translated version. While the translation was good in the fan version, it felt a little sterile and didn't quite capture each characters various methods of speech, especially Tsukuyomi, Meiya and Takeru. The images were also only partially translated but that was mostly down to the limitations of the tools used to extract and modify the images, seeing them fully translated though really makes a difference. This version also includes more voice lines for Takeru and additional scenes that weren't included in the initial PC release (I believe this is a port of MuvLuv Alternative Winows 7 edition) so even for people like myself who have read it several times and have seen every 'ending' theres still new things to see.

All in all an excellently done localisation of the single best sci-fi visual novel ever written, quite possibly THE  best visual novel full stop.

[olist]
[*]Kimi ga Nozomu Eien (в оф. русской локализации - Беспокойные сердца) - аниме сериал

35059674.review:
An experience quite unlike any other. 

Never have I been so emotionally manipulated by any other sort of media. When things began turning for the worse I had a difficult time coping with and accepting what was happening.

It's not a perfect story by any means. It has some pacing issues, a ton of exposition at certain points and personally while the main character's development is exceptional some of his irritating personality traits from the original persist throughout the novel. Yet, if there was any experience in any media I could convey to others, Alternative would be it.

Possibly both Alternative's biggest boon and sin is the necessity of its predecessor. While the original Muv Luv had many cringe-worthy absurdities the player had to trek through, it was imperative to really see what the main character is fighting for and how that influences the actions he takes, along with how the world affects him. Above all I feel, is that it really helps immerse the player into the MC's role and mindset. This particular element is what makes some of Alternative's best and infamous scenes so emotionally compelling. I have never been sent into such a state of disarray by one certain scene and most people who have read MLA will know what scene I'm referring to.

The writer supposedly sold his ancestral home to fund this game(which originally released in 2006) and it really shows with the production values far exceeding that of most modern VNs. The in-game sprites are all lip-synced and blink, the sound-design is top notch, there's a dedicated UI for when you're in a mech, a ridiculous amount of CGs, a ton of sprites including minor characters and a ton of sprite animations for both the characters and mechs.

If anyone has any shred of interest in this, I implore them to go in as blind as possible. I wish the in-game menus and promotional material didn't spoil a bunch of elements but even so I can whole-heartedly recommend this. I can't guarantee it'll be your favorite VN or anything(there are many who would refer to Alternative as such) it's something that will certainly stand out among its peers and present you with an experience only it can offer.

35059474.review:
When I first read Muv-Luv Alternative a few years back, I wasn’t sure what to expect. Coming off of Extra/Unliminted (the prequels), the series didn’t seem to have gotten off to a good start. But after indulging in it for nearly 100 hours over 2 weeks, I was so engaged in this visual novel that I can firmly say that it is my favorite of all time. 

Alternative completely deviates from the atmosphere and tone set in Extra/Unlimited and takes a more serious, gritty approach to sci-fi worlds. It takes the characters established in Extra and the setting introduced in Unlimited, then pushed them to their maximum potential. 

Muv Luv Alternative is an epic in the full sense of the word. It is a long journey that takes you and the characters through many trials and tribulations. This novel manages to fill every crossroad with meaning and growth. It invests so much into its characters to make every loss painful and every victory as heartfelt as possible. 

I have no good way to relay all the emotions and respect I have for this title. Alternative is truly one of the best sequels to exist being much better Extra/Unlimited. In fact, I’d even go venture to say that it is one of the best sci-fi adventures I have ever read. But more than that, the story has left such a great impression on me that I can’t forget any of the moments in it. I became so invested into the world and the characters struggling through it. Everything they felt, I felt as well. 

Of course, Muv Luv Alternative is not without its flaws, but I’ll let other reviews sift through those fine points. It’s not something for the faint of heart as for how dark and gruesome it can get. But, I wanted to share a bit of my own feelings and experiences with this work to hopefully inspire others to witness this masterpiece. Muv Luv Alternative is an experience like no other, and as such, I highly recommend it to anyone with even the slightest bit of interest. .

Muv-Luv Alternative is a true masterpiece. I played the original release of the game multiple times and it was only further improved in this release on steam. I don't need to make much comment on the characters or art style since they are the same as in Extra and Unlimited so you know what to expect. If you haven't yet played those first two games in the Muv-Luv, I STRONGLY recommend playing them first as without the context and without knowing the characters, the unbelievable impact of Alternative will be lost.

THE STORY of Muv-Luv Alternative is what makes it so special. This piece of fiction is my favourite story ever, in any medium. I haven't found a novel, TV show, movie, ANYTHING that I enjoyed the plot of more than Muv-Luv Alternative. This story will pull you in and bring you on a rollercoaster experience you have never seen before. The "ABOUT THE GAME" section here on steam might sound a bit dramatic but I wholeheartedly agree with how epic they make this game sound. If you could ever imagine yourself enjoying a dark and thrilling piece of science fiction then you need to play Muv-Luv Alternative.

Muv-Luv Alternative brings a whole new feel to the Muv-Luv series. Where the transition from Extra to Unlimited toned down the romance and comedy and brought in a more intricate storyline, Alternative is another step up from that. Don't expect much comedy here.

Compared to the original, the steam version seems to have fixed the horrible Engrish and has polished some game assets.  The main problem with the original was the horrible game engine which is completely gone now. The game runs on a sleek, quick engine and is very nice visually.

Muv-Luv Alternative isn't just a game, it's a journey.

I can't recommend it enough.

35056566.review:
As visual novels go, it doesn't get much better than this.  Depending on reading speed, you're in for about 80 hours of story that will put you on an emotional roller coaster.  Alternative is the sequel to Extra/Unlimited.  In the previous games you followed the main character as he first dealt with normal high school days and then when he somehow ended up in a world under attack by the BETA.  

Now you get to see how it all comes together in the end.  I won't say more than that about the story.

As for the game itself, what I've experienced so far makes this feel like the best version of the game.  I've previously read the fan translated version and while that was good, there were some sacrifices made(including several scenes that required stopping to read a text file).  While I haven't had much time with this release I can already see vast improvements.  For example, in the opening scene there are english voices used and those have been re-dubbed so they now don't sound like native Japanese trying to speak english.  These are scenes that were always supposed to be in english, but now they actually sound like it.  

If I had one gripe it would be about a small full screen issue.  When switching to full screen or starting the game in full screen, the windows taskbar will still be on top of the game.  Clicking on the taskbar and then back on the game will resolve this, but it seems like an issue that should be there.  This same bug seems to be in Extra/Unlimited as well.  But this is literally the only issue I've noticed and it wouldn't keep me from wholeheartedly recommending this.  

Just be sure to get and read Muv Luv Extra/Unlimited first!

35056328.review: This game is famous in the Visual Novel world, and for good reason. It's a wild ride that will have you laughing, crying, and on the edge of your seat through epic battles as humanity makes its last stand against the malevolent BETA. This story is, above all, a coming of age story for our protagonist. Takeru continues his journey and discovers what it means to be a soldier, a friend, and a lover. He discovers happiness, anguish, despair, duty, and everything in between. You, as the reader, will be put in the same spot as he is: A stranger in a strange land. An alien world to us, where death is accepted as a daily occurence and vast swaths of the Earth lay in smoldering ruins. But Takeru isn't satisfied with that, and I'm sure you aren't either. So get ready for the ride. Saving humanity from the BETA isn't going to be easy, and it isn't going to be pretty. I can tell you one thing, though. It's worth it.

35055880.review:
So i'll leave a short review since i don't want to spoil much

First of all, how was the localisation? Pretty damn good, they've re-done the translation completely and have managed to capture the character kinks and speech charms a lot better than the original translation, they've also included extra CG's for certain scenes and extra dialouge here and there making it a much better experience, and the upgraded engine making it run smoother. along with every diagram/map being fully translated it helps you understand what's going on better.

Next i'll just give my opinion on alternative itself

It is, without a doubt, the best Visual novel on the market (That's been translated) that i have ever read
You DO need to have read most of the routes of  Extra and at least 1 of Unlimited to enjoy this, it's a part 3 to Muv-Luv's first two parts

The story is incredible, it takes what you thought you knew about the betaverse of the series and blows it all away, nothing you learned in the first two VN's is entirely accurate, there are many secrets yet uncovered and many points of developments to be had.

The strongest point of Alternative is most definitely it's character development, whilst the characters themselves may be fittable in to the standard Archetypes, the way they're made to interact with the expansive world and other characters plus the inceredibly intruguing events that take place in this VN breathes life in to them, i've heard people saying that having only one route makes this VN bad, however you should not look at it this way, Alternative does not have 'one route', it is a single story with one outcome, The characters develop together and better themselves through debate, conflict, sorrow and such forth, unlike route based novels where the development is lopsided, everyone develops together.
Also on this note, the main character does not suffer from the self-insert problem that most vn's suffer from, in fact he is  the most amazing source of character development throughout this novel.

Anyway, the novel deals with some heavy topics such as general ethics, patriotism, politics, coping, ptsd and many more in an absolutely beautiful way, this isn't some shitty Eroge nor is it a Kusoge, if you think it's either you're simply reading it wrong.

Most of this was just rambling, but this was my 6th time reading this novel through and i'm glad that i backed it when i did, our folks over at the Muv Luv Team did an amazing job bringing such a great localisation to us in such a short time for a VN this length, and they even managed to dodge the censor bullet that most Steam releases fall to (I mean, yeah there's no explicitally r-18 scenes however most scenes were completely uncensored apart from the 2 original h-scenes which were basically just given a new CG that displayed less and had the text remain mostly the same, which is great)

35055635.review:
People ask, If you could experience one thing for the first time again, what would it be?
My answer: The Muv Luv Trilogy. MLA is by far the best fictional story I've ever experienced, and nothing has topped it since I first read it about 3 years ago. I discovered this series because it is the highest rated VN on VNDB. I had only read a few other VNs before, so, I instantly got interested and dove into it practically blind. I would highly encourage you to do so too. 

Despite my high praise for this series, Muv Luv is not perfect. Far from it in fact. However, one thing it does better than anything else is a subversion of expectations. After reading through the happy-go-lucky Extra and Unlimited, I was beginning to have my doubts that this VN was going to be the masterpiece that it was hyped up to be. And god damn, I've never been so glad to be wrong. Parts of this VN have some of the best writing, character development, and plot twists I've ever seen. But other parts are extremely sloppy and rushed. I have some mixed feelings about parts of Muv Luv, but overall I would still consider it to be my favorite work of fiction.

With that, I'll go over some good, bad, and neutral points about MLA with minimal spoilers.

Good:
-MLA has the best story I've ever read. It gives one of the most emotionally powerful experinces I've ever had. Takeru's character developement is nothing short of a masterpiece. The story sheds light on many different topics, including military strategy, PTSD, quantum causality, politics, nationalism, philosophy, traumatic psychology, time loops, etc. The characters, old as well as new, are great, each with their own views on the world and the ongoing war.
-Muv Luv has an amazingly well written multiverse. The logic is consistent and key points make sense within the world's perameters. Nearly every part of the military operations are explained in great detail, all the way down to squad formations, technical specs of the TSF's, and strategic countermeasures for each type of BETA.
-There in a incredible use of foreshadowing, with later major events being traced back to even the opening scenes of Extra. The payoff for reading Extra and Unlimited is truely amazing.
-The action sequences are a fantastic, as Muv Luv Alternative has one of the highest production values out of any VN. 
-MLA features an amazing soundtrack.
-The mecha design is amazing. Each TSF is based on a real life fighter jet counterpart, and the weaponry is conventional, unlike something you would see from Gundam or any other mecha show.

Neutral:
-You have to sit through about ~30 hours of a non-action, slice of life, slapstick comedy VN trilogy before you get to the "good part." This could be a plus or minus for some. I was one of the weird ones who really enjoyed the first two VNs in the trilogy. However many do not, especially if you're coming for the action and mecha aspect. DON'T be that guy, please. It's extremely important to read the first two VN's before Alternative. It's called a trilogy for a reason.
-There are points in this VN where its visuals might be too much for squeamish people. There is a heavy use of gore and nudity during some key story points.

Bad:
-The ending arc was obviously rushed. I feel like there could have been a much more comprehensive and well thought out ending, since the one we got felt a bit cheap. Some people argue that an ending is what really makes a story good or bad, and this might be one of the biggest complaints from readers.
-If you don't get emotionally invested in the story from reading through Extra and Unlimited, the story will be very ineffective. It relies on the reader to experience emotions similar to that of the main character. 
-With such a big cast of characters, I feel like we did not get to see each one's development as well as we should have. Many new characters are introduced about half way into the story, and once they show up, many of the old characters lose any and all focus and dialogue.
-The best songs in the sountrack are usually only played in a few specific parts, and most of the time it uses songs from Extra for background noise during conversation.

Visual Novels tell the reader the story through the eyes of the protagonist. This might be the most important aspect of MLA, and the reason why it is so successful at telling a compelling and emotional story. Not being able to know what Takeru was thinking all the time would have made this VN significantly less impactful. MLA's intense action sequences, soundtrack, and excellent production value elevate the story to a new level. For these reasons, MLA could never do well translated into any other medium, and only really works as good as it does as a Visual Novel.

TL;DR: The Muv Luv Trilogy is absolutely amazing. If you're willing to sit through quite a bit of set up, the payoff is incredibly rewarding, giving you one of the best and most emotionally gripping stories ever written.
